intro: Gymnotrix nigricans, commonly known as the black gymnotus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers, which are tubular in shape and attract specific pollinators. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Gymnotrix nigricans is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
